div.p: No.2652, p. 559, unit 73, VPRS 1187/P, outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office of Victoria.
Document is a circular to the heads of 14 departments within the Chief Secretary’s Department, individually addressed. Chief Secretary's Office

Referring to my circular of the 24th September last,
See H. Moors to M, 24 September 1885. I have now the honor to enclose for your information and guidance copy of a further circular letter addressed to me by the Public Service Board setting forth their interpretation of Section 160 of the Public Service Act and to request that you will be good enough to furnish the particulars required by the Board in regard to any officers who have attained or will shortly attain the age of sixty years and whose services you have recommended should be continued beyond the 30th proximo.
See M to T. Wilson, 14 May 1886 (in this edition as 86-05-14a).
